121112.content:
It was just another normal-ish day for 7-year old Lilo Pelekai, she and Stitch were on her way to hula class where she would once again have the pleasure of seeing her friends...who, quite honestly, did not treat her like friends at all. They always called her weird, coming up with names like "Weird-lo" to mock her for reasons she just couldn't understand. Just because she needed to give Pudge the Fish a peanut butter sandwich to keep him satiated and homemade doll didn't make her weird!

Thankfully she had Stitch, who in no uncertain terms had become her best friend, always having her back and always protecting her from any danger that her alien-chasing life might throw at her. She also had Victoria, who had moved to her town and joined her hula class and somehow found the things she was interested in really cool. Her being there made it easier to cope with Mertle and the others putting her down all the time.

As she walked through the door of the school, she saw all the girls huddled around Mertle for some reason, clamoring as if she were a queen of some kind. Lilo rolled her eyes as Stitch blew a raspberry in annoyance, this seemed to be the norm when it came to Mertle and her posse, whatever Mertle did was deemed amazing, even if she did nothing at all. As she went over to put down her bag, she overheard some of the discussion taking place.

"So are you the tallest kid in class now?"

"I should be, after all I'm the best dancer and the smartest too. It only makes sense I should be the biggest, and after my growth spurt, I should be!"

"Let's see, I wanna measure!"

"Me too!"

Yuki, Teresa and Elena all took turns standing back to back with Mertle, and while Yuki and Elena were indeed shorter than Mertle, Teresa was about the same size, and Lilo knew just by looking that Victoria was still taller than Teresa, so that she meant she was taller than Mertle too...not that Victoria was going to say anything, she figured all of the arguing was a waste of time. Lilo smiled when Victoria waved her over, and the other girls crossed their arms in annoyance.

"You're on time today!" Victoria joked.

Lilo laughed back. "Yeah, Pudge wasn't hard to find today, I gave him his peanut butter sandwich and hurried over...but I dried off this time first."

"Leave it to Weird-lo to make feeding a fish a priority over hula class."

"YEEEEEAAAAAHH!"

Victoria and Lilo both made a face at the girls' snarkiness. "Anyway, you wanna meet up later?" Victoria finally asked.

"Sounds like fun!"

"Yeah, playing your little girl games sounds like a lot of fun." Mertle scoffed and put her hands on her hips. "You wouldn't fit in with us big girls anyway."

"I'm still taller than you Mertle, just knock it off already." Victoria rolled her eyes.

"But she's not!" Mertle pointed accusingly at Lilo. "Go ahead Freak-lo, stand next to me and we'll settle this."

"Fine!"

"Lilo, don't!" But it was too late, Lilo went over and gave in to Mertle's taunting, prompting Victoria to smack her palm against her face.

And sure enough, when they stood back to back, Lilo was just a tiny bit shorter than Mertle. "See? I'm bigger than you now, so you have to do what I say from now on!"

"Yeeeeeaaaaahh!"

"Yeah, I don't think so." Lilo walked off and went over to Stitch, who seemed concerned by what just happened.

"Lilo?"

"Mertle drives me crazy Stitch!" Lilo grumbled quietly. "There's gotta be a way to get her to back off about this!"
---------------------------

What happens next?

12111212221112211.content:
Lilo made her way downstairs, barely fitting inside the elevator Jumba had built inside their home. The barefooted girl walked into the kitchen to see Pleakley and Stitch there, Stitch was already chomping down on his breakfast and glugging down a huge mug of decaf coffee, while Pleakley had his back turned as he was facing the stove, a pink apron around his neck and a chef's hat on his head as he made Lilo's breakfast.

"Hey guys!" Lilo chirped with a grin.

The eggs that Stitch had in his mouth slowly fell back onto his plate as his jaw dropped at the sight of the 6'4" girl, the 7-year old was gigantic, almost needing to duck just to get in the room. "Lilo big!"

"Yep," Lilo's smile was smug as she carefully sat her butt down into a kitchen chair. As she was getting bigger all around, that meant everything was growing proportionately; Lilo's butt barely fit in the seat, and she had adjust herself very specifically to ensure she wouldn't fall off the chair. "I guess you could say I'm having a bit of a growth spurt."

"Well that's a completely normal part of the Earthling developmental stage." Pleakley said without turning around. "And since Earth girls mature faster than Earth boys, you're bound to start having spurts of growth. It's possible that you're an early bloomer, which means that soon you'll start experiencing-"

"Pleakley!" Lilo shouted to cut the alien off. "That's okay, I'd rather not get all the gory details about my own body. I only like monster gore, not ME gore."

"Well it's hardly gore," Pleakley said as he waved his spatula around, tossing tiny bits of egg around the kitchen. "It's just a normal part of development, I dunno why you're so freaked out about it, it's going to happen to you anyway, you may as well be prepared."

"Just let me eat my breakfast, we're gonna be late for hula class."

"Fine," Pleakley sighed as he poured Lilo's scrambled eggs from the pan onto a plate. "Just don't complain when you hit puberty and you start growing like a WHAAAAA!" Pleakley dropped the plate onto the ground, eggs flying everywhere as the three-legged alien took in the sight of a giant Lilo with his one giant eye. "Lilo! You're...you're ginormous!"

"So?"

"SO?!"

"Yeah, so." Lilo got up and went to the fridge to find a replacement breakfast. "Like you said, it's just a normal part of the Earthling developmental stage."

"Normal?!" Pleakley flailed his arms wildly as he screamed at the top of his lungs. "Normal would be growing an inch! Growing double your size in a day isn't normal! It's the opposite of normal, It's-it's-it's UN-NORMAL!"

"Don't worry about it!" Lilo finally pulled her hand out of the fridge, holding a whole huge handful of fruit. "I'm just a growing girl is all, so what if I break a few records along the way? It just makes me more special!"

Stitch and Pleakley watched with stunned expressions as Lilo ate the entire handful of fruit in one bite, rubbing her belly with contentment before letting out a belch that could be heard through the house.

"S'cuse me." Lilo blushed...then she felt a warm feeling envelop her body from the inside out. "Whoa...I suddenly feel terrific! Like...something's happening!"

"Uh oh..." Both Stitch and Pleakley said simultaneously.

"I...I think I'm growing!" Sure enough, Lilo began to increase in size yet again. "This is so cool! I wonder how big this'll make me?!"
12111212221112211.title: Breakfast = Growth Fuel

Lilo's eyes swiveled around in an attempt to try and see if there was any place she could shift to try and get without breaking more than she already broke. She could feel a wet spot on the back of her dress where she must've crushed the fridge and sink and water was pouring out, the table had been smashed to pieces, and even still she had grown so big she had to scrunch herself into a ball just to not kick her foot through the kitchen wall. Resigning herself to her fate, Lilo stretched out the leg that didn't have Stitch practically attached to it and forced down the wall, leaving a gaping hole that she could use to scoot out of her prison. "Hope Jumba doesn't mind a construction project." Once she got out, she stood up to her full height, now about 20 feet tall, almost as tall as the house itself. "Wow! I got big! REAL big!" Lilo put her hands on her hips and grinned smugly. "Betcha Mertle can't make fun of me for being short now."

"Good." She stood back up and surveyed the area, loving just how tall she was. "This is so cool, I wonder if I'll get even bigger! Now I know why you liked it so much Stitch." Then she remembered something. "Hey, what happened to Pleakley?"

121112122211122112121.content:
Lilo finally arrived in town, marveling at how much smaller everything seemed. She was as tall or taller than a lot of the buildings around. As usual, it was bustling with activity, and as soon as Lilo arrived, it began bustling even more as some of the islanders and tourists started screaming in fear at the giant little girl...others simply stared in shock, totally frozen as Lilo walked down the street.

Some even shrugged it off as just another weird happenstance...there were those who'd gotten used to stuff like this happening, and it always worked out for the best. Panicking had gotten monotonous.

But, sure enough, there were still plenty of people scared of Lilo, afraid that she'd step on them, either by accident or on purpose. "These poor folks are probably afraid I'm gonna hurt someone." Lilo waved at everyone and tried to put on what she hoped was a reassuring smile. "It's alright everyone, I'm not gonna hurt you! I'm not the kind of giant you see in the monster movies, although it would be cool to meet one of them since I'm this big now..." She shook her head to refocus, her long hair swishing around her face. "I'm a good giant! The kind who wants to make friends and help people!" Then Lilo spotted something in the distance, and as she squinted to get a better look, she smiled brighter as she saw a familiar face. "It's Mrs. Hasagawa! Let's go say hi!"

"Okie taka."

Lilo continued walking, her steps making booms as she did so. It took a matter of seconds for the 20 foot tall girl to make it to Mrs. Hasagawa's fruit stand. The elderly lady was a kind soul, though she was often forgetful and had trouble seeing and hearing sometimes. "Hi Mrs. Hasagawa!" Lilo said as she got down as low as she could to be closer to the woman.

"Oh, hello Lilo!" The old woman replied with a smile in her wavering voice. "You're coming in loud and clear today, this new hearing aid of mine must really be working! Now if only my new eye prescription would do the same."

"It's not your hearing aid Mrs. Hasagawa! I've grown a lot, so my voice is louder than it used to be."

"Oh of course, you're getting to be a big girl, Lilo!" Mrs. Hasagawa chuckled, still totally oblivious to what she was seeing as her glasses didn't really help her much. She had no clue just HOW big she'd gotten. "Oh, please tell your sister that I would like to speak to her about the job opening I have. I think she wanted to talk to me about it but we never had a chance!"

"That was...over a year ago Mrs. Hasagawa."

"Oh was it?" She smacked her palm against the side of her head. "Silly me. Well, if she ever changes her mind, please tell her anyway!"

"I will."

"Good." She turned to her fruit stand and pulled two apples, handing one to the blue blob that was Stitch, and the other blob that she assumed was Lilo. "Here, take these and enjoy. After all, growing little girls need nourishment to keep growing!"

"You have no idea." Lilo shook her head with an exasperated smile. "Have a good day Mrs. Hasagawa."

"And you too!" The woman turned away and grabbed her hose to water down her produce as Lilo stood to her full height and began walking away, her footsteps again causing the ground to shake. "Lot of earthquakes today, I'll have to check the news when I get home."

As Lilo continued on her way, she started at the tiny apple that only really fit between her fingertips, tossing it in her mouth and swallowing it without even chewing. "You know if I keep growing like this, I may have to learn how to find food in the wild, like on those survival shows!"

Stitch laughed at the joke as he too swallowed the apple whole.

"Hey, Stitch...is that..."

12111212221122221.content:
As the two sisters got in line to check out, Lilo eyes wandered around the store, enjoying her new much higher vantage point. All of the things she couldn't see before, like over people's heads. It was as if she was seeing the world for the first time, how had she ever managed before her massive growth spurt? Despite it only being hours, it felt like a lifetime ago that she was desperately trying to reach things on shelves...and now she wouldn't even have to stretch anymore. "This is awesome, is this what it's like for you Nani?"

"Not quite, but after we buy these shoes I'm setting up an appointment for you to get a checkup."

"Huh? But why?"

"Because I don't think there's ever been a case where someone has grown this much in such a short amount of time! We need to make sure you're actually okay."

"I told you I feel great though! I don't feel sick, I'm not in pain, I have more energy than I've ever had in my life! I-" Lilo cut herself off when in her peripheral vision she spotted a flash of light brown hair with blonde tips, and her heart immediately went into overdrive. "Is that...Keoni?!"

"Lilo, what are you-"

"You know what? Go ahead and make that appointment big sis...I wanna go say hi to a friend...a very special friend."

"Lilo wait!" Nani's words fell on deaf ears, and her turn with the cashier came up just as she ran off, pinning Nani where she was. "Great. Stitch, can you bring her back here please while I pay for these?"

"Okie taka!

Meanwhile, the unsuspecting Keoni was in the boy's section, checking out the latest in shoe designs. "These kicks are sick." he said to himself as he reached for the next pair.

"Hi Keoni."

The voice drew his attention, recognizing it as Lilo. "Hey Lilo," He started to turn around to look at her. "How's it go...ing." The boy's eyes widened in shock. Lilo's chest was where her face should have been, at least the last time he saw her, which was last week. "Uhhhh..."

Lilo couldn't help but smile, Keoni always seemed so tall to her, so out of reach...her crush on him had only grown as he continued to treat her with kindness, and now it was with great delight that she made the mental connection: her body was now matching her growing crush. "How's it going?" She asked for him with a cute grin as she swayed back and forth. "I'm just here to get some new shoes, I kinda had a growth spurt and outgrew my old ones."

"Yeah...no kidding."

"It's pretty cool, now I know what it's like for you!" She took a step closer to him, the boy frozen in place as his brain tried to process what was happening. Lilo was so tall that the top of her head was at his nose, whereas normally she'd barely reach his chest. He was tall for his age, a few inches away from 5 feet, and to see Lilo almost as tall as him left him speechless, unsure of how to react.

"You know, I've never really gotten a chance to see your eyes so up close before." She said. "They're really brown."

"Uh...yeah, they are. I mean..."

"What's wrong Keoni?" Lilo put on an exaggerated pout as she placed her hands behind her back. "Aren't you happy to see me?"

"O-Of course! Yeah, it's...good to see you Lilo." He smiled a bit, blushing as she leaned in closer to him. "So...growth spurt huh?"

"Yep!" She beamed at him. "I just started growing like a weed, I noticed today during hula class..." She lidded her eyes halfway, doing her best to look flirtatious like she'd seen on TV. "How do I look now that I'm bigger?"

"You uh...you look great Lilo."

"Really? Thanks!" And with that, Lilo lunged forward and wrapped the brown-haired boy into a big bear hug, snuggling him and causing him to blush profusely from the public display of affection. Fortunately - or unfortunately depending on point of view - Stitch showed up at that moment to break it up, tugging on her skirt to pull her away.

"Goocha! Goobaja!"

"Aww, do we HAVE to?"

"Ih." the experiment nodded an affirmative.

"Fiiiiine." Lilo rolled her eyes before finally letting Keoni go, smiling at him demurely. "I'll seeya around Keoni...who knows, maybe the next time you see me, I'll be even bigger!"

Keoni's eyes widened. "Seriously?"

"Maybe! I'm a growing girl after all..." In a burst of confidence brought on by her increased size, Lilo leaned and gave Keoni a lingering smooch on his cheek, and he blushed beet red as a result. "And I'd love to go through the experience with someone I REALLY like."

"Uh..."

"Ugh...iki bah bah!"

"Okay, I'm coming...bye Keoni!"

"Bye...Lilo..."

They made their way out of the store at last, where Nani was waiting for them by the front door...with a knowing smirk on her face. "You finished making him blush?"

"Oh you saw that huh?" Lilo smiled proudly with her hands on her hips. "Guess being almost as big as he is gave me a confidence boost! And it TOTALLY worked!"

"Alright, alright. I'm glad you got to enjoy yourself, but you're not out of the woods yet. I still want to get you checked out...this kind of growth, it isn't normal."

"Normal's overrated," Lilo waved her hand dismissively. "Besides, if being big got Keoni to notice me like THAT? I wouldn't mind getting even bigger! Maybe he'll ask me to be his girlfriend! I look a lot more like the girls he normally hangs out with now."

"Nyah nyah, Lilo huaa boojiboo!"

"Oh stop, he's not my boojiboo...at least not yet."

"Let's just get you home before we have anymore surprises."

1211121222112222122.content:
As soon as they got home, Lilo ran to the elevator leading to her room and jumped into her bed, squealing into her pillow like a lovesick schoolgirl. She still couldn't believe she'd actually done what she did. Keoni was so flustered by her, it looked like he actually might LIKE like her now that she'd grown to a height closer to his own. 4 foot 4 was a lot better than her old tiny height. She briefly looked behind her and saw that her feet reached the end of her bed. Clearly, she was on the verge of outgrowing it, and she was only 7 years old! She kicked her feet excitedly and squealed into her pillow again. This was officially, without a doubt, the greatest day of her life. The only thing that even came close was the day she met Stitch.

She hoped with everything she was that she was nowhere near done growing.

Lilo's attention was grabbed by the sound of rapid footsteps scurrying up the elevator shaft. Stitch, no doubt. Sure enough, seconds later, her beloved alien friend appeared with a curious expression. "Ohufi!"

"Hey Stitch!" Lilo hopped off her bed, stumbling a moment when she reached the ground faster than she was used to. "That's gonna take some getting used to. Can you believe how big I've gotten?"

"Gaba ika tasoopa?"

"What's the big deal? The big deal is that I'm big! Mertle won't be able to make fun of me anymore, Keoni paid more attention to me than he ever has, and I won't have to try so hard to reach things anymore!"

"Aka tikuta."

"I know, you're bummed out because it didn't work out for you." Lilo patted Stitch's head. "But humans are supposed to grow, experiments need to be their regular size in order to do what they were designed to do. That's what Jumba said."

"Naga bootifa."

"Look, Short Stuff may not be as clumsy as you were when you were huge, but even he can't do what Jumba originally designed him to do anymore. We found him something he could do as a kaiju-sized monster that's totally unrelated to his original programming. But that doesn't mean I don't still love you."

"Ohhh..." Stitch groaned good-naturedly as Lilo wrapped him into a big hug. "Tay yuuga."

"I love you too Stitch." Lilo released the blue alien from her hug and took on an excited grin. "I wanna go exploring around the house, everything must look so different now that I'm big! Care to join me?"

"Ih!"

With that confirmation, the two best friends went back down the elevator and zipped around the house, checking out anything and everything. When Lilo went to the kitchen, she headed to the pantry and saw some cookies that Nani had placed on the shelf that was originally too tall for her. "Nani's been hiding snacks this whole time! No wonder she's not complaining about the healthy menu Pleakley keeps making." She eagerly grabbed the box and stuffed a few mini-cookies in her mouth...but then she spit them back out when she realized what kind they were. "Oatmeal raisin? Where's the chocolate?!" She reached into the box again and felt around, pulling out a piece of scrap paper that had something scribbled on it.

Nice try, Lilo.

"Touche big sister." Lilo grumbled while Stitch laughed at her misfortune. "Whatever, she probably has the really good stuff on the shelf above that one. It's only a matter of time before I get even bigger, then I'll be able to enjoy whatever she's got hidden from me."

"Gatchi nosty?"

"No, I'm not really sure if I'll keep growing. But I'm hoping I will! And the power of positive thinking can do amazing things!" Lilo and Stitch then moved on to the bathroom sink. There she saw the footstool she used to be able to reach it. Though she now had an easier time of it, she was disappointed to find out that she still needed the stool to comfortably reach everything, as well as see herself in the mirror. "Bummer. Guess I'm still too small."

"Quala chifa pi nolo."

"Why's everything in this house built for super tall people anyway? Didn't anyone consider the needs of the vertically challenged?" She glanced at Stitch for a moment. "The kind who can't climb on walls to reach whatever they need?" Just then the doorbell rang, and Lilo was instantly distracted from her moping. "I'll get it!" She ran to the door and opened it, and there she saw...
1211121222112222122.title: Re-exploring Home

12111212221122221222.content:
Lilo forced a gasp back into her throat when she saw her crush Keoni standing on her porch. She'd expected Victoria, since they agreed to meet up later. But somehow, she didn't find herself disappointed in the slightest. In fact, nothing against her best human friend, Lilo was extremely happy to see it was Keoni instead of Victoria. Her heartbeat was running a mile a minute, her cheeks flushed. "K-Keoni! Hi!" She cleared her throat and tried to push down her excitement. "Hi," she said more quietly. "To what do I owe the pleasure?"

"Um...well..." Keoni scratched the back of his neck awkwardly. "I was...just in the neighborhood, thought I'd come over and...check on you."

"Oh." Lilo blushed a little deeper. "Well, thanks. I'm doing pretty good. Why? Did I give you the impression that I wasn't feeling well?"

"N-No! No...it's just...after our um...encounter at the shoe store," Now it was Keoni's turn to blush. "I was curious as to what happened to you. Wanted to make sure everything was okay."

Lilo smiled, her 7-year old heart swelling at the touching sentiment. "Aww, that's sweet of you." She couldn't help but giggle girlishly. "But I'm okay...in fact I'm better than okay! I can safely say that today has been one of the better days of my whole life." Lilo then became shy again. "Although..." she looked down at the ground, her hands behind her back as she rubbed the bottom of her foot against the floor. "There is something that could make today even better..."

"Oh yeah? What's that?"

Lilo slowly walked up to Keoni, her new height once again showing just how much she'd grown. She seemed to fit perfectly next to him, and the thought caused her heart to race even faster. "Well...now that I'm big...I was wondering if maybe...we could hang out together? Like, just the two of us?"

Keoni smiled shakily as Lilo wrapped her arms around his neck. "S-Sure!"

"Great!"
12111212221122221222.title: Keoni, what's he doing here?

choices: Lilo grows right there on the spot!
121112122211222212222.content:
"So...maybe we can meet up tonight? I'm expecting Victoria to come over soon and I don't wanna leave her hanging. But I would love to see you later, maybe for a movie?"

"Movie! Yeah, movie sounds great!" Keoni chuckled and slowly wrapped his arms around Lilo to reciprocate the embrace. He never realized it before, but Lilo's hair smelled really nice, a tropical mixture of pineapple and coconut that reminded him of the paradise he called home. That revelation prompted him to squeeze a little tighter and close his eyes. "Can I make a confession, Lilo?"

"Absolutely! You can tell me anything!"

"Promise you won't think I'm weird?"

Lilo pulled back and raised an eyebrow at him. "Keoni, I've made hulas about mud monsters and I think zombies are cool. I've spent all my life being told I'm weird. I'm sure that anything you have to say, it won't be anything I can't handle."

"Fair enough. Okay...the truth is, I came here because you said something that got me really curious."

"So it wasn't just to check on me?"

"Well that was part of it! But...really it had more to do with..." He gulped nervously, his anxiety rising as he fought to spit out what he had to say. "I wanted to see if it was true what you said."

"Wait a minute..." Lilo smirked. "Was it because I said I'd be even bigger next time you saw me?"

"You promised you wouldn't think I was weird."

"I don't! In fact, I'm glad to know that this growth spurt of mine got your attention." She pressed even close to him, looking up at him and batting her eyelashes flirtatiously. "So...you like tall girls then huh?"

"Y-Yeah...I dunno why."

"Well that's okay. I can understand why you'd find that so cool. The thought of me growing and growing, bigger and bigger..." Lilo slowly raised herself onto her tiptoes, and she felt her heart beat faster when she saw Keoni's eyes widen. "It makes me excited too."

"You mean it?!"

"Yep!" Lilo pulled away and put her hands on her hips, standing as tall as she could at her full 4 foot 4 height. "I've always been too small, or at least that's what people told me. But the bigger I get, the more possibilities open up for me! Maybe you can help me grow faster! Would you like that?"

Keoni nodded, completely speechless as his brain all but shut down. Something had awakened in him through this experience, and Keoni didn't care. Now, all he wanted was to watch Lilo grow taller and taller.

Just then...

12111212221122221222212.content:
The tingling sensation finally came to a stop when Lilo reached the relatively gargantuan height of 5 foot 5. If she were an adult, that size would still technically be shorter than average...but for a 7 year old girl, she was huge! "Soooo cool!" Lilo was practically bursting at the seams with excitement and giddiness. Just two weeks ago, she was only 3 foot 5, and now she was a whole two feet taller than she used to be. And the way Keoni was looking at her, stunned and speechless, her confidence grew right along with her as she sauntered up to him, looking down at her crush (maybe boyfriend?) with a flirtatious gaze. "You said you liked tall girls, right Keoni?"

"Uh huh..." Keoni nodded.

"Well you're in luck." She wrapped her arms around Keoni, who was now several inches shorter than her after her latest growth spurt. Now their roles had reversed, as his head fit perfectly over her shoulder. "If I keep growing at this rate, soon I'll be the tallest girl in the world!" She glanced down at the hypnotized boy. "Would you like that Keoni? For me to be the tallest girl ever? Keep growing until I touch the clouds?"

"Uh huh..."

Lilo giggled. Clearly, Keoni wasn't really able to think too well. He was obviously too lovestruck for his brain to function. And all because of her? She couldn't believe it. "I dunno how I'm growing," She thought to herself. "But I really don't care if Keoni reacts like this over it." Her crush was all hers now. And not only that, Mertle would never be able to brag about being the tallest girl in class ever again. Before, it was Victoria and Theresa who were the tallest, while Mertle tried to act like that wasn't the case. But now there was no room for debate. Lilo was the tallest girl in the hula class, and she might even have the world record for tallest 7 year old in history. She would have to check later.

For now though, she had another visitor.

"Lilo?!"

Who was it?

1211121222112222122221212211.content:
"Hey! What's happening?!" Mertle panicked while the others watched in shock as Mertle slowly dwindled down to size. "Everything is getting bigger!"

"No, you're getting smaller!"

"This isn't fair! I just had a growth spurt!" Mertle's griping didn't help at all though, and she continued to shrink until she was a mere 2 feet tall, smaller than even a toddler. "What did you do to me Weird-lo?! You got jealous and made me shrink somehow!"

"Now how would I do that?" Lilo crossed her arms in annoyance.

"I dunno! The same way you made yourself bigger! Weird things always happen when you're around! You better fix this, I'm not about to spend the next 3 years of my life the size of a baby, freak-lo!"

Lilo frowned and stomped her foot right next to Mertle, causing the redheaded girl to shriek in fear as Lilo crouched down to glare at her. "I think you should be a little nicer to the one you're counting on to make you normal again! Especially if she can squash you!"

"O-Okay! Okay! Just don't hurt me!"

Lilo stood back up to her full height and sighed, letting the flow of adrenaline pass her by. Obviously, she had no intention of actually hurting Mertle. Murder wasn't something she planned on putting on her reputation. But it was nice to be able to shut her up for once. "Okay, so, obviously something strange is going on. But we can figure this out."

"So I guess your growth spurt isn't natural, huh?" Keoni asked.

"Guess not." Lilo frowned. "Is that bad?"

"I don't think so. Blessings come in many forms."

Lilo's smile returned. "Good. Because if we can figure out how we're changing size, who knows what the limit could be!"

121112122211222212222121221112.content:
There was no denying it anymore, both Lilo and Keoni were greatly enjoying this entire experience, natural or otherwise. It was almost a game at this point, especially with them chanting the word 'bigger' for every single spurt she had all the way to her new colossal height of 6 foot 2. Sighing with contentment as the tingling sensation faded away once more, Lilo looked down at Keoni with a grin, seeing as the boy she once looked up to both figuratively and literally now only reached the bottom of her nose. And she had a feeling that there was still more growing to come. "Man...what a rush. Did you like that Keoni?"

"Did I like it?" Keoni replied as he stared up at the enormous 7-year old. "That...was the most radical thing I've ever seen! You're...you're huge!"

"I am pretty big aren't I?" Lilo said proudly as she put her hands on her hips. "I think I'm even bigger than Nani by now! Guess that makes me the big sister and her the little sister."

There was one person, however, who was not excited about everything that was happening. "Hey! Did you forget about me?!" The still 2-foot tall Mertle Edmonds shouted up from her lowered vantage point. "I don't wanna be a shrimp for the rest of my life! Hurry up and fix me!"

"Maybe I don't wanna fix you Mertle." Lilo frowned down at the tiny girl who spent years bullying her. "Maybe this will teach you a lesson about being nice to people instead of always trying to boss them around. In fact, maybe that's why I'm growing and you're shrinking, so you know what it's like to be treated like you don't matter!"

"T-That's ridiculous!" Mertle spluttered indignantly. "You can't just leave me like this! What will my mom say when I come home the size I was when I was just 3 years old?! I'll tell her that you used some freaky weird voodoo on me! You'll be arrested for sure!"

"Still being mean huh?" Lilo hummed nonchalantly. "You know Keoni, I think I feel another growth spurt coming on."

"Stop it!" Mertle screeched as she covered her ears. "Just stop!"

Seeing Mertle suffering finally broke Keoni out of his mind fog. As much as he was enjoying watching Lilo grow, he was the type of person who didn't like seeing people be hurt, even if they usually hurt others themselves. "Hey Lilo, I think we should figure out a way to help her now." He said.

"But...Keoni," Lilo whined, looking down at the boy with a disappointed frown. "I thought we were having fun! Don't you wanna see me grow some more? I bet the next growth spurt will make me taller than basketball players!"

"We can't just leave Mertle like this, Lilo." Keoni said sternly.

"But...she treats me like a freak."

Now Keoni's expression softened, seeing Lilo so disheartened. As determined as he was to help Mertle, he knew how much the glasses-wearing girl tormented Lilo for no other reason that he knew of other than she thought it was fun. Keoni was reminded that in spite of how big Lilo was now, she was still only 7 years old. Things like fitting in with her friends and other kids being mean to her had a real effect on her, and she was still learning how the world worked. Sure, he was only 11 and was learning too, but he still knew more than she did. Clearly, Lilo still needed his guidance. "I know it's hard to want to help someone who's mean to you Lilo." Keoni said as he placed a hand on her arm. "But that's what makes someone really special, and I know you're special. In a good way. It's not just because you're growing that you're special, it's also because I know you want to help people. That includes her."

After taking a few moments to really ponder Keoni's words, Lilo finally nodded in agreement. "You're right Keoni. Thanks for talking to me."

"Hey, anytime." Keoni smiled. "You wanted me to help you grow remember? That's not just physically."

"Touche." Lilo laughed. "Alright Mertle...we'll figure out how to get you back to normal now. First, we have to figure out what's causing us to change sizes so much."

12111212221122221222212122111221.content:
Once again the temptation to leave Mertle behind struck Lilo. She was really enjoying growing, and if an experiment was making her grow while Mertle shrank, then why should she even bother trying to convince the experiment to fix things? Mertle was always so mean, even to Teresa, Yuki and Elena, the ones she actually called her friend! Being stuck as a dwarf would be the perfect punishment.

But then she remembered what Keoni said, about being special and helping others, even when they don't deserve it. Groaning internally, Lilo made her decision. She wanted to make sure Keoni knew he was right about her...after all, if she wanted him to fall in love with her for real, she needed to prove she was more than just the bigger girl...she needed to be the bigger person. Hunkahunka already showed her what it was like to have someone in fake love with her. She wanted more than that.

"Alright, you guys can come too." She finally said. "But be careful, I think one of Stitch's cousins is the one making us change size, so we don't wanna scare it!"

"Then maybe you should stay behind, and let me and Keoni look for your creepy pet." Mertle snarked. "You being a giant would probably scare it away, since your ugliness is even more obvious than usual."

Lilo was about to counter that, but she didn't have to, as Keoni stepped in and looked down at the 2-foot tall Mertle with a disapproving stare. "You know Mertle, Lilo's right about one thing. You really don't treat people nicely at all. If I were you, I'd seriously reconsider how I act if you don't wanna find yourself alone when you're older." Then Keoni glanced at Lilo, noticing how impressed she was that he was reprimanding her. Then he smirked as he looked back down at Mertle. "In fact, if you're gonna act like a little brat, then you should be treated like a little brat."

"What?!"

"Lilo," Keoni looked back up at the tall girl. "Why don't you pick her up and carry her with us? I don't think she'll be able to keep up with us anyway."

"You've gone crazy! Whatever weirdness she has rubbed off on you!"

"You're right Keoni, she definitely won't be able to keep up otherwise." Lilo grinned and reached down to pick up Mertle, the glasses-wearing girl taking off running as she screamed for help. Of course, there was no way she was going to be able to escape, and it wasn't long before Lilo had Mertle in her arms and soon hefted over her shoulder like a sack of potatoes. "Wow, she's not even heavy!"

"Put me down right now Weirdlo!" Mertle screeched as she pounded on Lilo's back with her fists, kicking and screaming with all her might. "My mom'll sue you for this!"

"She just doesn't get it." Lilo shook her head and decided to make a bold move, reaching for Keoni's hand to hold it. She felt her heart rate rise substantially when Keoni held it back, and she had to keep herself from squealing at the top of her lungs. She couldn't keep the blush off her face though.

"Blech," Stitch made a face of disgust. "Meega-o-itume."

"Oh stop," Lilo rolled her eyes at the little blue alien. "Alright, let's go find Stitch's cousin! Stitch, can you sniff it out?"

"Okie-taka!" Stitch was more than eager to focus on the experiment hunt instead of Lilo's lovie-dovie nonsense....or maybe he just needed to see Angel, it had been a while since he'd heard from her. Maybe after all this was over, he'd seek her out and enjoy some alone time with her. As Stitch scurried along the ground, his nose and ears on high alert, he finally caught the telltale scent of a genetic experiment...and it wasn't coming from him. "Chi meetoh! Tiki baba!"

"You found it Stitch?!" Lilo exclaimed. "Come on, let's catch it before we have anymore problems!" Lilo started running, dragging Keoni along as he desperately tried to keep his feet on the ground. Lilo could cover a lot more ground now that she was over 6 feet tall, and it only took her seconds to spot the experiment. "There it is!"

The experiment was a small purple creature with a white lower jaw and chest, three tentacle-like legs, two stubby little arms, and two floppy antennae with two rings. It was also using levitation in order to travel.

But...there was a problem. "Uh oh!" Stitch exclaimed. "Maka maka!"

"Oh no!" Lilo gasped in horror at what she was seeing,

12111212222.content:
Soon enough, a knock on the door got Lilo's attention. Nani was still at work and would be for a few more hours, Jumba and Pleakley were at their ship working on a project...hopefully NOT Experiment 628, 627 had already proven to be almost more than they could handle, and while she would have loved for it to be Keoni, she knew that was unlikely as she hadn't seem in a days. That left only one other option.

"That must be Victoria." she said as she went over to the door to answer it, totally oblivious to the odd look Stitch was giving her as he tried to process what was happening.

Once Lilo opened the door, sure enough there was Victoria, now dressed in her usual white shirt and red shorts, her hair pulled into a high ponytail. "Hey Li...lo..." Victoria's jaw dropped, she'd suspected something was off after what went down in hula class, but now there was no doubt about it, Lilo had definitely grown, not standing three inches taller than she was, which was crazy considering Victoria was three inches taller than Lilo earlier that day. "Lilo?! You...you've grown!"

It was at this moment that Lilo herself came to realize what had happened: suddenly being taller than Mertle, her shoes not fitting properly, she'd had a massive growth spurt! "Whoa...you're right, I HAVE grown!" She looked at her own hands before examining herself all around. "But how'd that happen?"

"I dunno, but whatever happened must have happened while we were at hula class, because you were still shorter than me before!"

"Probably." Lilo turned to walk over to the wall where her measurements were and stood against it, standing up as straight as possible. "Hey Stitch, grab a pencil and make a mark for me please."

"Okie-taka." Stitch zipped off and returned seconds later with a pencil in hand, and he crawled up the wall to get the necessary altitude to make the mark, calculating the amount in his head before rasping out the final answer. "Four..foot..one."

"Seriously?!" Lilo's eyes widened. "That's...that's six inches taller than I was the last time I measured!"

"Wow Lilo, you're really tall for your age now, and you're DEFINITELY the tallest kid in class now!" Victoria exclaimed. "I bet Mertle's gonna be real surprised the next time she sees you."

"Yeah, you're right!" Lilo grinned with excitement. "I dunno how I got this big but I like it!

choices: Leave the experiment alone while Lilo slowly grows through class
Stitch can't run the risk of the experiment escaping, chase time!
121112123131.content:
Lilo's taunting only served to make Mertle angrier, as she doubled back on her previous ego-trip and reverted back to her old tried and true method, making herself feel big by making Lilo feel small, even if it was only metaphorical instead of literal now.

"Yeah, whatever Weird-lo," the orange-haired girl scoffed with her arms crossed over her chest and a condescending expression on her face. "That just means you're even weirder than we thought. Right girls?"

"Yeeeeeeaaaaaahh."

The now taller girl fumed at being shut down for the umpteenth time. Finally she'd gotten one up on her friend/enemy and it was brushed aside like no big deal, made into even more ammunition for Mertle to make fun of her. "Well you know what Mertle? If I'M the bigger one now, then that means YOU have to do what I say instead! It works both ways after all!"

"Yeah, right. Like I'd ever let YOU tell me what to do." Mertle flicked her hair over her shoulder and walked over to the stage where they would begin their hula class, her posse following along with their noses pointed into the air.

"Arrgh!" Lilo dragged her hands across her face in frustration. "That Mertle, she's just so...so...ugh!"

"Lilo, are you okay?" Victoria said as she placed a hand on her shoulder. "You seem...tight."

"Yeah, I'm okay, thanks Victoria." Lilo relinquished a tiny smile in thanks before her face twisted in discomfort. "Although I kinda feel like my sandals are tighter than they should be...I could've sworn they weren't like this when I got here."

"Maybe you were just too worried about getting here on time?"

"That could be it." Lilo shrugged. "I know that Moses has been getting upset with me for being late all the time, maybe I just never had the time to notice how tight they were getting on me. For a teacher, Moses sure spends a lot of time just worrying about being punctual."

"I'm surprised how tall you are though, I thought you were still shorter than me when I first saw you."

"Yeah, me too! Guess I was just slouching all this time. But I'm not complaining, I LIKE being tall!"

"Me too," Victoria grinned. "Between you and me," she whispered to her friend. "I'm glad we're the tallest kids in class now, that means we'll be the ones who get to be the center of attention during dance rehearsals, instead of Mertle."

"Oh yeah! Cool!" Lilo pumped a fist in excitement. "Being big rocks! I can't wait to get home and update my measurement!"

"We still on to meet later? Maybe we can measure each other before we start playing."

"Sounds like a plan to me! Stitch just downloaded the newest update of Zombie Slayers 4 on our computer, can't wait to show it to you!" Just then, Moses called for the girls to come to the stage as class was about to begin. "Guess it's time to get started."

"Yep, race you there big girl!"

"Hey! No fair!" Taking off their sandals so they could begin class, the two girls laughed as they hurried over to the stage to get started with hula class...while Stitch stayed back and scratched his chin as his super-computer brain processed what had happened.

"Jaalba naga graazi..." the experiment mumbled to himself in his own language. Unlike Lilo and Victoria, his mind could tell that something had changed. Lilo was not that tall when they walked in the door of the school. Then, his super-sensitive nose picked up a scent. "Cousin?" Looking around the room, Stitch eventually spotted a small purple experiment with a white lower jaw and chest, three wobbly legs, two stubby little arms and two floppy antennae with two rings hiding in the corner. "Ikata!" he whispered to himself.

Stitch immediately began brainstorming. This experiment may have had something to do with Lilo's sudden growth spurt, but Lilo was already on thin ice with the teacher. If Stitch caused a ruckus now, Lilo might not get to come back to the school again, especially after the hole in the wall debacle Stitch had accidentally caused a few days ago.

Sure, he fixed it, but that wasn't the point.

Chasing down the experiment now would scare it, and who knew what would happen then? But if he just stood by, the experiment could escape and then who knew when they'd find it again? Plus, it could be the key to Lilo's growth. What was he to do?
121112123131.title: "Yeah, whatever Weird-lo."

1211121231312.content:
Stitch decided to risk chasing after it, the experiment had already hopped out the window and was now peeking around the corner of the door, possibly scoping out its next target. Stitch didn't know for sure how powerful this experiment was, but he knew that any experiment on the loose that hadn't been rehabilitated and found its one true place where it belonged could mean chaos.

Looking around the room, Stitch found an open window he could crawl out of without alerting the experiment to his presence. He made his way out the window, quietly walking on all fours so as not to startle his target.

Unfortunately, he wasn't quiet enough, and the experiment got spooked and took off running into the foliage.

"Spubata!" Stitch called after it, but it was clear the experiment wasn't sticking around to talk. Stitch hesitated to go after it again, he didn't want to leave Lilo alone, especially if she'd need his help...but on the other hand, his cousin was frightened and probably willing to use its powers on whatever got in its way, all of Kauai could be in trouble if he didn't stop it.

12111222.content:
Victoria couldn't help but feel bad for her friend. Lilo wasn't weird, just misunderstood, and Mertle and her posse seemed to take great delight in making Lilo miserable for reasons she couldn't even understand...or at least, Mertle herself did, Lilo had told her about the times Yuki, Teresa and Elena actually spent time with her and seemed to enjoy the experience before ultimately deciding to go back to Mertle after Lilo did or said something they weren't expecting.

Not bullies themselves, but not exactly making things better, just followers. It was a shame that something as inconsequential as height was the latest reason for Lilo to be mocked by Mertle's little group, it's not like there was anything she could do to help Lilo grow taller, Victoria was naturally tall thanks to her family's genetics, it wasn't anything special she did.

It was at that moment that Victoria felt a lightbulb turn on in her mind. She remembered reading a story online about two giant monsters that attacked the carnival not too long ago, and now one of those monsters had actually been re-purposed to become its most popular ride. Of course, Lilo told her all about that adventure, as those monsters were Stitch and one of his cousins. Lilo had used a growth ray to give Stitch a growth spurt so he could ride the carnival rides, but things got out of hand in a hurry.

Maybe though, Victoria could use the ray to make Lilo bigger instead! All she would need to do is give her a quick and subtle zap, and Lilo would be just big enough to make sure Mertle didn't bug her anymore. With her plan in mind, Victoria went over to Lilo and tried to comfort her as best as she could for now. "Don't worry about her Lilo, I'm sure you'll hit a growth spurt soon."

"Maybe." Lilo looked up at her slightly taller friend. "I hope I can be as tall as you Victoria."

"I'm sure you will be." Victoria held back a knowing smile. "Come on, let's get hula class over with, then we can go to your house and play."

"Okay."
12111222.title: Victoria helps her friend out

choices: Lilo's grown a whole foot taller
121112221.content:
As soon as hula class was over, Lilo and Victoria bolted from the building, not wanting to risk giving Mertle and her posse another chance to take a shot at Lilo's morale. They hurried over to Lilo's house, which was apparently empty except for them. "Hey Lilo, why don't you see if you can find us a snack while Stitch helps me set up our game?"

"Sounds like a plan to me!"

Victoria watched as Lilo walked into the kitchen, then once she was out of sight, Victoria grabbed Stitch by the arm - much to the experiment's shock - and ran into another room, placing her finger to her lips to quiet him down. "I need your help Stitch."

"Gaba?"

"I wanna help Lilo feel better, do you know where that growth ray you guys used before is?"

"Ohhh, el kiyotay!" Stitch grinned and zipped off to Jumba's room; Victoria could hear Stitch rummaging around somewhere, and she could swear she heard a cat screech before Stitch came back with a small device. "Hagata!"

"So this is it huh? Doesn't look all that complicated." Victoria took the device and examined it, spotting the switch that would make things either bigger or smaller depending on where it was pointed. "Awesome, this'll make things big AND small! I'll be able to reverse it if I make a mistake." Sneaking over to peek around the doorway to the kitchen, Victoria and Stitch saw Lilo trying to reach up on the countertop, stretching as high as she could on her tiptoes to get a can of ravioli. "This is perfect! Let's give her a boost and help her reach the counter!"

Lilo grunted as she stretched for the can of ravioli, her eyebrows furrowing in frustration as her lack of height again inconvenienced her. Closing her eyes for one final stretch, she reached out with all her might, feeling a strange tingle that lasted for only a second...and when she opened her eyes, she managed to grab the can. "Finally! Can't wait until I'm taller so I don't have to try so hard anymore. And pushing a stool is just insulting."

As she went over to grab a couple of forks, Victoria had rushed off to the room they were supposed to meet in with her eyes wide. "Did you see that?! She actually got taller!" She looked down at the growth ray in her hands. "This thing really works, I wonder how much bigger she is now?"

She got her answer when Lilo walked in. "Hey Victoria, Nani hasn't gone grocery shopping yet, so all we really have is some cans of ravioli." Lilo then noticed both Victoria and Stitch staring at her. "What?"
